text: Vaux-devant-Damloup is a former commune in the Meuse department in Grand Est in north-eastern France. It had a population of 67 (2012). On 1 January 2019, it was merged into the new commune Douaumont-Vaux.Arrêté préfectoral 19 December 2018 Cupola at Fort Vaux Fort Vaux is partially located within the territory of the commune (the other part is in Damloup). It was one of the French villages destroyed during World War I, the new village was rebuilt near the old village. The old village is now a memorial. ==See also== * Zone rouge (First World War) * List of French villages destroyed in World War I * Communes of the Meuse department ==References== Vauxdevantdamloup
title: Vaux-devant-Damloup
